climbs.name: You'll See
climbs.fa: Eric Boarman / Jim Henry / Evelyn Allen / Scott Griggs

content.description: Starts with a lieback, just right of the first bolt. Climb through some relaxed climbing to a stiff, boulder-problem crux that guards the chains.
content.location: Left of Community Effort. Right of Prelude To Harvest.

content.description: Steeper start takes you to technical crux in the top third.
content.location: First route to the left of Ritz Bitz

content.description: Short route with bolts spaced closely. Easy and laid back makes it great for teaching someone to take their first lead.

Basic face climbing into the dihedral. Come out-and-left to finish at the anchors of Beginner's Luck (5.5). Cleaning this route is a bit of a pain due to the anchors being so far offset from the bolt line.If you climb straight up and out of the dihedral into the plants/vines above, you're going the wrong way.
content.protection: 3 bolts to the ring anchors of Beginner's Luck (5.5). Very well protected.
content.location: This route had been previously covered by several shrubs and small trees, but was cleared by an SCC trail team. This route starts just near a small bush/tree at the base of the wall. The route is to the left of Sporting Doylies (5.4) and to the direct right of Beginner's Luck (5.5).

content.description: Short route but still a fun little 10c.
content.location: Starts at a small ledge, this route is just right of Sportin Doylies.

content.description: A fun varied climb with 2 steep sections broken up by a small ledge. Starts out with a flake that leads to a bulge, then a mantle to more jugs and finally a steep juggy finish. Really fun, well worth doing.

I love this route. It has a lot to offer. It starts out on a delicate crimp and goes up the face to a steep powerful overhang. Move over the bulge and clip the fixed oval 'biners hanging in chains above your head. It's a lot of excitement packed into a short route!
content.location: Down the stairs and to the right. The route is right where the starts to to curve left a little bit towards a section of harder routes.

content.description: Crux in middle with small holds. Good climbing.
content.location: Tag that says Northern Invader to the left of my little secret

content.description: Defined crux up top. Route is fun with good jugs down low and technical up top to gain some pockets.    Be weary of loose blocks at bottom of route. I pulled one off while climbing it several years ago, but nothing has come off since.
content.location: First route to the left of Ritz Bitz

content.description: If you're looking to break into 5.11, then make Mustang Sally your project. This route is often overlooked, but it's got some cool moves to it.
content.location: The trail briefly turns to stone below the route.

content.description: Technical and powerful in the middle. Route trends straight up and then left at bolt three to a rest.
content.location: First route to the right of Ritz Bitz and to the left of Three Wishes.

content.description: Crux is near the chains, with another relatively hard portion while clipping the second bolt.
content.location: Directly to the right of You'll See and left of Beginner's Luck.

content.description: This is a short route and climbs over a small roof near the top but gives a big fun factor. The crux is between the first and second bolt. Pulling over the roof/block is like candy for a tired climber, it has big jugs and easy feet.
content.location: Left of Mr. Green Jeans. It is the first of the 2 routes you come to that climb over the roof/block at the top in this area.

content.description: Good first lead, right next to Sporting Doylies
content.location: Left of Sporting Doylies and right of Community Effort. Has plaque underneath the route

content.description: Climbs over the small roof at the top of the wall. The crux is pulling the roof but stays a consistent 5.8 all the way. There is a hard to see pocket on this route that makes things much easier and half the fun is finding it! Shhh, nobody give it away :)

BETA SPOILER. Climb up to the first good stance. Clip draw #2. Move strong off of two crimps to a crescent and on up to bolt three; shake out this is your best rest. Crux, bust right to heinous gaston. Stick with it to the top.
content.location: One route to the right of Mustang Sally on the Lonesome Wall.

content.description: Climb the face to the right edge of a large crack/flake. Follow the bolts into a gap between two faces and to the anchors. It's a solid warmup for any climbing on the West Side.
content.protection: Three bolts with a chain belay.
content.location: Directly to the left of the obvious roof of Baby Kangaroo. Marked by a right-facing flake that begins halfway up the route and leads to a steep, blocky section of wall.

content.description: Short but good. This route is a little more crimpy than the others and probably the hardest 5.8 in this section.
content.location: Just to the right of Mr. Green Jeans
